description: Not every problem needs to be overcome, just the ones stopping you from getting where you want to be.
author: Ann Hill

description: You should know that when a message you convey to another person is not understood by him, at least one of the following things is true: what you have said is not true, or you have conveyed it without kindness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

description: To the most trivial actions, attach the devotion and mindfulness of a hundred monks. To matters of life and death, attach a sense of humor.
author: Zhuangzi

description: It is unfair to you, to compare your raw insides to someone elses' well defined outsides.
author: Anonymous

description: Hope is like a road in the country; there was never a road, but when many people walk on it, the road comes into existence.
author: Lu Xun

description: On Action: I prayed for twenty years but received no answer until I prayed with my legs.
author: Frederick Douglass, abolitionist, author, and runaway slave.

description: Often the difference between a successful person and a failure is not one's better abilities or ideas, but the courage that one has to bet on one's ideas, to take a calculated risk—and to act.
author: André Malraux

description: The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.
author: Carlos Castaneda

description: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
author: Albert Einstein

description: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

description: The person who asks is a fool for five minutes, but the person who does not ask remains a fool forever.
author: Anonymous
